reviews.title: A good experience at a fair price.

reviews.text: The room was spacious, clean and amenable and the food was excellent for the price we paid.

reviews.text: The waiter service was outstanding and all the staff were excellent in their friendliness and efficiency.
reviews.title: Savoy Hotel - Bournemouth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would certainly go to this hotel again if the desire arose.
reviews.title: 5th visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent stay,went with a Shearings coach tour and stayed in room 106 with great garden and sea views from the balcony!Restaurant was very good had breakfast and dinner everyday of our stay with a super choice menu.Staff were great no problem about going again.
reviews.title: very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned form a 2 night stay at The Savoy Hotel, with my wife and her parents.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful time. Bournmouth itself is lovely and very clean, so much to do.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel, freindly staff, clean and comfortable rooms with amazing views.
reviews.title: Brilliant Break in Bournemouth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was brilliant, we booked dinner bed and breakfast and enjoyed every meal.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff ,but oh so cold rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival, we were told that we would dine at 7.45 pm. There was no choice over this time. The newspaper had to be paid for in advance and collected at reception. No record of fee paid for car parking. Room was cold and fan in bathroom failed to switch off and when we reported it we were ignored. Loud banging from water pipes at night and early in the morning. Again, reported this and we were ignored. Evening meals lacked choice. Lunch time meals disorganised and chaotic. Too many coach parties which seemed to take priority over other hotel guests. Despite writing and emailing the head office to express our disappointment over the service that we received, we have again been ignored.
reviews.title: Disappointing experience at The Savoy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were so disgusted with the service and state of the hotel that we checked out after the first night of the two night booking.
reviews.title: Good location shame about Shearings itinery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at other Shearings hotels on numerous occasions and have always been very happy with the hotels and service.
reviews.title: Great value Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just come back from the Savoy hotel, which is a very nice place, with flat access to the Reception and extensive lounges. The hotel overlooks lawns, which run down to a line of trees with a view of the sea in the distance. The West cliff is just a 2 min walk from the hotel and overlooks the beautiful golden sands. The interior of the hotel is very well decorated, clean with very large,comfortable, seating areas. The dining room is set out with, mainly, tables for 2, and the young staff are very efficient and friendly. We were given room 15, which is on the ground floor alongside the car park. It was quite large and designed for guests with mobility problems, very nicely furnished and very clean, also very warm and quiet. The only downside as far as the hotel was concerned was the evening meal which was not to our liking - no roasts and no salads were on offer. As to the Shearings itinery, Salisbury is a quite unremarkable town and the Cathedral was too far away from the coach park for people with limited mobility to visit. Southampton was a complete waste of time unless you just wanted shops, we never saw a ship as the docks were too far away and we had 4 hrs to 'kill' there. Shearings also offered 2 other optional outings at a cost of £8.50 per person - one to Dorchester and the other a tour around Bournemouth,Sandbanks and Poole. Not enough passengers took up the tour so it was cancelled. Most of the passengers on our coach used the local buses to visit the coastal towns around Bournemouth , So, to sum up, I can recommend the hotel, but would point out the anomolie s in the Shearings excursions to passengers with mobility problems.
reviews.title: Perfect seafront position of this Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Great Hotel for value - very near to the centre of Bournemouth and Beaches. Staff very friendly in all areas.and the Hotel is very clean Can be full of Coach parties at times - just sit in the Bar and count the great and many varieties of Walking stick! Overall, good value for money - just make sure you book your Parking space when you Book your room.
reviews.title: Nostalgic

description: The Savoy Hotel is a prime example of Victorian architecture. It is one of the closest hotels in Bournemouth to both beach and town centre, and stands in extensive grounds on the town’s fashionable West Cliff, and provides a scenic and relaxing location for leisure travellers. Inside, the hotel is has been sympathetically decorated and maintained. Bournemouth boasts over two thousand acres of parks and gardens. With an excellent climate, the town nestles in chalk cliffs, sheltered by the Purbeck Hills. Stroll around stylish boutiques in elegant Victorian arcades, or roll your trousers up and enjoy miles of golden sandy beaches.The Hotel houses all of the amenities and facilities you would expect from a Coast & Country venue. In addition, our staff will offer you a warm, friendly welcome, and make sure that your stay is as relaxing and memorable as possible.
